author: axic3354
content: In retrospect having a tiny Shanghai instead of Arrow Glacier would have been nice to crank out those simple EIPs. It feels like with Shanghai planned for later this year and the breadth of proposals just means it will be impossible to ever get up to speed, i.e. everything will get pushed out again.

author: lightclient
content: I really feel like we need to get to a place where we can improve different parts of the protocol in parallel

author: axic3354
content: Absolutely, though most of these proposals affect many parts at the same time.

author: axic3354
content: evm,  transactions (p2p), storage

author: trent_vanepps
content: re: <@!489256758989029405> suggestion, is two calls every two weeks too big of an ask for execution teams? (one for EIPs and one for Merge) i do echo tim in that it might just be the same people anyways, but maybe these things need more time

author: sky.cactus
content: I suspect there will be *some* people who show up to both calls, but not everyone will I think.

author: sky.cactus
content: I also think we just need more regular cross-team communication in general and we don't seem to be getting much of that via Discord.  üòñ

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: We already have two calls every week now: CL call + ACD

author: timbeiko
content: Yes, and I'm also a biit skeptical of adding more calls when we don't constantly go overtime in our current ones...!

author: sky.cactus
content: That suggests to me that we do need more calls, we have more to talk about than we are allowing ourselves time to talk about.

author: gcolvin
content:
> We already have two calls every week now: CL call + ACD
To what extent does the CL call already overlap with CL portions of the ACD call?  Would it suffice to just shift more of the CL aspects of ACD call to the CL call?

author: timbeiko
content: Both calls cover the merge in the first half

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> it feels like CL call could take the role of the merge call until the merge?

author: timbeiko
content: But why remove merge stuff from the EL call? The discussion today was super valuable

author: timbeiko
content: I think it‚Äôs really good that our iteration cycle on merge stuff is weekly vs biweekly right now. I guess I disagree that we need more EL non-merge time urgently

author: timbeiko
content: Especially, more scheduled in advance, recurring, non merge EL time. We can of course do a bunch of ad hoc calls which are focused on individual topics.

author: timbeiko
content: And I‚Äôm also very mindful of keeping as much of our focus on the merge as possible until it‚Äôs actually done. IMO the constraints on time/attention for non merge things right now are a net positive.
